author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Bitcoin on Friday briefly surpassed the $70,000 mark for the first time before retreating to around $68,000. The recent boost in the world's largest cryptocurrency's price is driven by investor demand for US Bitcoin ETFs and expectations for cuts in global interest rates. Last month, Bitcoin's market capitalisation surpassed the $1 trillion mark for the first time since November 2021.
title: Bitcoin crosses $70,000 mark for 1st time

author: Abhinav Rattan
content: Bitcoin reached a new all-time high price of $69,255 on CoinGecko today before quickly dropping back down to $66,700. The top cryptocurrency's previous all-time high of $67,617 was notched in November 2021. Bitcoin made new highs on some exchanges like Coinbase on Tuesday before immediately plunging 14%, causing $1 billion in liquidations across the crypto market.
title: Bitcoin hits new all-time high before dropping again

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Rating agency Moody's has raised its forecast for India's real GDP growth in FY24 from 6.6% to 8%, citing the government's capital expenditure and strong domestic consumption. "We expect India to be the fastest-growing economy among major G20 countries," Moody's said. It recently also raised India's GDP growth forecast for calendar year 2024 to 6.8%.
title: Moody's hikes India's FY24 GDP growth forecast from 6.6% to 8%

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Billionaire Elon Musk said he is fine with US President Joe Biden's proposal to impose a minimum tax of 25% on billionaires. However, he stated that it is "false of Biden to claim" that the tax will solve the country's rising deficit issue. President Biden said the tax would raise $500 billion over the next 10 years.
title: Biden wrong to say 25% billionaire tax will solve US deficit: Musk

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Karnataka's High-Level Clearance Committee on Friday approved six new projects worth ₹8,220 crore and eight supplementary investments worth ₹9,615.85 crore. The investment proposals are expected to create more than 27,000 jobs in the state. Wistron's ₹2,095-crore proposal to assemble smartphones and Air India's ₹1,750-crore MRO facility project were among the approved proposals.
title: K'taka approves proposals worth ₹17,836 cr; to create 27,000 jobs

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: The total amount collected via systematic investment plans (SIPs) crossed the ₹19,000-crore mark for the first time in February. SIP inflows stood at ₹19,187 crore last month, compared to ₹18,838 crore in January, as per data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India. The total number of SIP accounts also surged to 8.2 crore in February.
title: SIP inflows cross ₹19,000 crore for 1st time in February

author: Kanishk
content: The month of February turned out to be positive for the Indian startup ecosystem as venture capital funding rose by 21% due to the steady inflow of deals. The total VC funding stood at $890 million, cutting across 114 deals. The month of February witnessed most large deals with a ticket size in the range of $20-40 million.
title: Venture capital funding in February rises by 21% YoY

author: Vivek
content: Specialty coffee brand abCoffee has raised $3.4 million in a Series A funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners. Tanglin Venture Partners, an existing investor, also participated. The startup plans to use the raised capital to enhance its supply chain and technological advancements, with the ultimate goal of delivering on-demand coffee more efficiently and affordably.
title: Specialty coffee brand abCoffee raises $3.4 million in funding

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Philanthropist Sudha Murty, who has been nominated to Rajya Sabha, said she doesn't consider herself a politician. "I'm a nominated Rajya Sabha member. My son-in-law's (UK PM Rishi Sunak) politics is for his country and it is different, and my work is different," she stated. "I'm a government worker now," she added.
title: I'm not a politician: Sudha Murty after Rajya Sabha nomination

author: The Hawk Editor
content: Sudha Murty, philanthropist & author, was nominated to the Rajya Sabha. Holding 0.83% in Infosys, worth Rs 5,600 cr, she's celebrated for her social work & literature. Awarded the Padma Bhushan, she's also the mother-in-law of UK PM Rishi Sunak. PM Modi praised her nomination as a tribute to women's strength.
title: Sudha Murty holds close to Rs 5,600 crore worth of Infosys Stake
